blocks.name: abvcxp
blocks.content: Raising an absolute value to a power less than one yields another absolute value. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Sep-2014.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: ostth2lem1
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ ostth2 , although it is just a simple statement about exponentials which does not involve any specifics of ~ ostth2 . If a power is upper bounded by a linear term, the exponent must be less than one. Or in big-O notation, ` n e. o ( A ^ n ) ` for any ` 1 < A ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Sep-2014.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.content: The base set of the field of rationals. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Sep-2014.)

blocks.name: qdrng
blocks.content: The rationals form a division ring. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Sep-2014.)

blocks.name: qrng0
blocks.content: The zero element of the field of rationals. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Sep-2014.)

blocks.name: qrng1
blocks.content: The unit element of the field of rationals. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Sep-2014.)

blocks.name: qrngneg
blocks.content: The additive inverse in the field of rationals. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Sep-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm qrngneg(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cq), wceq(cfv(cfv(cminusg, c1), c0), cneg(c0)))
  -| wceq(c1, co(ccnfld, cress, cq))
} = {
  eqtr3d(cfv(cfv(cminusg, c1), c0), cneg(c0), cfv(cfv(cminusg, ccnfld), c0), wcel(c0, cq))
  mpan(wcel(c0, cq), wceq(cfv(cfv(cminusg, ccnfld), c0), cfv(cfv(cminusg, c1), c0)), wcel(cq, cfv(csubg, ccnfld)))
  ax-mp(wcel(cq, cfv(csubg, ccnfld)), wcel(cq, cfv(csubrg, ccnfld)))
  simpli(wcel(cq, cfv(csubrg, ccnfld)), wcel(co(ccnfld, cress, cq), cdr))
  qsubdrg()
  subrgsubg(cq, ccnfld)
  subginv(cq, ccnfld, c0, cfv(cminusg, ccnfld), cfv(cminusg, c1), c1)
  eqid(cfv(cminusg, ccnfld))
  eqid(cfv(cminusg, c1))
  syl(wcel(c0, cq), wceq(cfv(cfv(cminusg, ccnfld), c0), cneg(c0)), wcel(c0, cc))
  qcn(c0)
  cnfldneg(c0)
}

thm qrngneg(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ ℚ →((invg ` c1)` c0)= -u(c0))
  ⊣ c1 =(CCfld[|`s]ℚ)
} = {
  eqtr3d(((invg ` c1)` c0), -u(c0), ((invg ` CCfld)` c0), c0 ∈ ℚ)
  mpan(c0 ∈ ℚ, ((invg ` CCfld)` c0)=((invg ` c1)` c0), ℚ ∈(SubGrp ` CCfld))
  ax-mp(ℚ ∈(SubGrp ` CCfld), ℚ ∈(SubRing ` CCfld))
  simpli(ℚ ∈(SubRing ` CCfld), (CCfld[|`s]ℚ)∈ DivRing)
  qsubdrg()
  subrgsubg(cq, ccnfld)
  subginv(cq, ccnfld, c0, (invg ` CCfld), (invg ` c1), c1)

  eqid((invg ` c1))
  syl(c0 ∈ ℚ, ((invg ` CCfld)` c0)= -u(c0), c0 ∈ ℂ)
  qcn(c0)
  cnfldneg(c0)
}

thm qrngdiv(class c0, class c1, class c2) {

  simpli(wcel(cq, cfv(csubrg, ccnfld)), wcel(co(ccnfld, cress, cq), cdr))

  3simpc(wcel(c0, cq), wcel(c1, cq), wne(c1, nat0))
  eldifsn(c1, cq, nat0)

  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℚ ∧ c1 ∈ ℚ ∧ c1 ≠ 0)→(c0[(/r ` c2)]c1)=(c0[÷]c1))

  0le0()
  a2d(wcel(cv(hs1), cn0), wcel(c0, c1), wbr(cfv(c0, cv(hs1)), cle, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(c0, co(cv(hs1), caddc, nat1)), cle, co(cv(hs1), caddc, nat1)))

thm qabvle(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ c1 ∧ c2 ∈ ℕ0)→(c0 ` c2)[≤]c2)
  ⊣ c3 =(CCfld[|`s]ℚ)
  ⊣ c1 =(AbsVal ` c3)
} = {
  impcom(c0 ∈ c1, c2 ∈ ℕ0, (c0 ` c2)[≤]c2)
  nn0ind(hs0, hs1, c2, (c0 ∈ c1 →(c0 ` c2)[≤]c2), (c0 ∈ c1 →(c0 ` hs0)[≤]hs0), (c0 ∈ c1 →(c0 ` 0)[≤]0), (c0 ∈ c1 →(c0 ` hs1)[≤]hs1), (c0 ∈ c1 →(c0 `(hs1[+]1))[≤](hs1[+]1)))
  imbi2d(hs0 = 0, c0 ∈ c1, (c0 ` hs0)[≤]hs0, (c0 ` 0)[≤]0)
  breq12d((c0 ` hs0), cle, hs0, (c0 ` 0), nat0, hs0 = 0)
  fveq2(hs0, nat0, c0)
  id(hs0 = 0)
  imbi2d(hs0 = hs1, c0 ∈ c1, (c0 ` hs0)[≤]hs0, (c0 ` hs1)[≤]hs1)
  breq12d((c0 ` hs0), cle, hs0, (c0 ` hs1), hs1, hs0 = hs1)
  fveq2(hs0, hs1, c0)
  id(hs0 = hs1)
  imbi2d(hs0 =(hs1[+]1), c0 ∈ c1, (c0 ` hs0)[≤]hs0, (c0 `(hs1[+]1))[≤](hs1[+]1))
  breq12d((c0 ` hs0), cle, hs0, (c0 `(hs1[+]1)), (hs1[+]1), hs0 =(hs1[+]1))
  fveq2(hs0, (hs1[+]1), c0)
  id(hs0 =(hs1[+]1))
  imbi2d(hs0 = c2, c0 ∈ c1, (c0 ` hs0)[≤]hs0, (c0 ` c2)[≤]c2)
  breq12d((c0 ` hs0), cle, hs0, (c0 ` c2), c2, hs0 = c2)
  fveq2(hs0, c2, c0)
  id(hs0 = c2)
  syl6eqbr((c0 ` 0), cle, nat0, nat0, c0 ∈ c1)
  abv0(c0, c1, nat0, c3)
  0le0()
  a2d(hs1 ∈ ℕ0, c0 ∈ c1, (c0 ` hs1)[≤]hs1, (c0 `(hs1[+]1))[≤](hs1[+]1))
  expcom(hs1 ∈ ℕ0, c0 ∈ c1, ((c0 ` hs1)[≤]hs1 →(c0 `(hs1[+]1))[≤](hs1[+]1)))
  expr(c0 ∈ c1, hs1 ∈ ℕ0, (c0 ` hs1)[≤]hs1, (c0 `(hs1[+]1))[≤](hs1[+]1))
  letrd((c0 `(hs1[+]1)), (hs1[+]1), ((c0 ` hs1)[+]1), (c0 ∈ c1 ∧(hs1 ∈ ℕ0 ∧(c0 ` hs1)[≤]hs1)))
  syldan(c0 ∈ c1, (hs1 ∈ ℕ0 ∧(c0 ` hs1)[≤]hs1), (c0 `(hs1[+]1))∈ ℝ, (hs1[+]1)∈ ℚ)
  syl((c0 ∈ c1 ∧(hs1 ∈ ℕ0 ∧(c0 ` hs1)[≤]hs1)), (hs1[+]1)∈ ℚ, (hs1[+]1)∈ ℕ)
  ad2antrl(c0 ∈ c1, hs1 ∈ ℕ0, (c0 ` hs1)[≤]hs1, (hs1[+]1)∈ ℕ)
  nn0p1nn(hs1)
  nnq((hs1[+]1))
  abvcl(c0, c1, (hs1[+]1), cq, c3)
  syl((c0 ∈ c1 ∧(hs1 ∈ ℕ0 ∧(c0 ` hs1)[≤]hs1)), ((c0 ` hs1)[+]1)∈ ℝ, (c0 ` hs1)∈ ℝ)
  peano2re((c0 ` hs1))
  syl((c0 ∈ c1 ∧(hs1 ∈ ℕ0 ∧(c0 ` hs1)[≤]hs1)), (hs1[+]1)∈ ℝ, hs1 ∈ ℝ)
  peano2re(hs1)
  breqtrd((c0 `(hs1[+]1)), cle, ((c0 ` hs1)[+]1), ((c0 ` hs1)[+](c0 ` 1)), (c0 ∈ c1 ∧(hs1 ∈ ℕ0 ∧(c0 ` hs1)[≤]hs1)))
  syl3anc((c0 ∈ c1 ∧(hs1 ∈ ℕ0 ∧(c0 ` hs1)[≤]hs1)), (c0 `(hs1[+]1))[≤]((c0 ` hs1)[+](c0 ` 1)), c0 ∈ c1, hs1 ∈ ℚ, 1 ∈ ℚ)
  simpl(c0 ∈ c1, (hs1 ∈ ℕ0 ∧(c0 ` hs1)[≤]hs1))
  mp1i((c0 ∈ c1 ∧(hs1 ∈ ℕ0 ∧(c0 ` hs1)[≤]hs1)), 1 ∈ ℚ, 1 ∈ ℤ)
  1z()
  zq(nat1)
  abvtri(c0, c1, hs1, cq, nat1, caddc, c3)
  ax-mp(+ =(+ ` c3), ℚ ∈ 𝕌)
  qex()
  ressplusg(cq, universe, caddc, c3, ccnfld)
  cnfldadd()
  oveq2d((c0 ` hs1), caddc, (c0 ` 1), nat1, (c0 ∈ c1 ∧(hs1 ∈ ℕ0 ∧(c0 ` hs1)[≤]hs1)))
  adantr(c0 ∈ c1, (hs1 ∈ ℕ0 ∧(c0 ` hs1)[≤]hs1), (c0 ` 1)= 1)
  mpan2(c0 ∈ c1, (c0 ` 1)= 1, 1 ≠ 0)
  ax-1ne0()
  abv1z(c0, c1, nat1, nat0, c3)
  qrng1(c3)
  qrng0(c3)
  leadd1dd((c0 ` hs1), nat1, hs1, (c0 ∈ c1 ∧(hs1 ∈ ℕ0 ∧(c0 ` hs1)[≤]hs1)))
  syldan(c0 ∈ c1, (hs1 ∈ ℕ0 ∧(c0 ` hs1)[≤]hs1), (c0 ` hs1)∈ ℝ, hs1 ∈ ℚ)
  syl((c0 ∈ c1 ∧(hs1 ∈ ℕ0 ∧(c0 ` hs1)[≤]hs1)), hs1 ∈ ℚ, hs1 ∈ ℤ)
  zq(hs1)
  abvcl(c0, c1, hs1, cq, c3)
  qrngbas(c3)
  zred(hs1, (c0 ∈ c1 ∧(hs1 ∈ ℕ0 ∧(c0 ` hs1)[≤]hs1)))
  ad2antrl(c0 ∈ c1, hs1 ∈ ℕ0, (c0 ` hs1)[≤]hs1, hs1 ∈ ℤ)
  nn0z(hs1)
  1red((c0 ∈ c1 ∧(hs1 ∈ ℕ0 ∧(c0 ` hs1)[≤]hs1)))
  simprr(c0 ∈ c1, hs1 ∈ ℕ0, (c0 ` hs1)[≤]hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.w((c0 ∈ c1 →(c0 ` c2)[≤]c2))
  diff.hs0.w((c0 ∈ c1 →(c0 ` 0)[≤]0))
  diff.hs0.w((c0 ∈ c1 →(c0 ` hs1)[≤]hs1))
  diff.hs0.w((c0 ∈ c1 →(c0 `(hs1[+]1))[≤](hs1[+]1)))
  diff.hs1.w((c0 ∈ c1 →(c0 ` hs0)[≤]hs0))
}

blocks.content: Induct the product rule ~ abvmul to find the absolute value of a power. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Sep-2014.)

thm qabvexp(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {

  -| wceq(c4, co(ccnfld, cress, cq))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cabv, c4))
} = {
  3impia(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cq), wcel(c3, cn0), wceq(cfv(c0, co(c2, cexp, c3)), co(cfv(c0, c2), cexp, c3)))

  imbi2d(wceq(cv(hs0), nat0), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cq)), wceq(cfv(c0, co(c2, cexp, cv(hs0))), co(cfv(c0, c2), cexp, cv(hs0))), wceq(cfv(c0, co(c2, cexp, nat0)), co(cfv(c0, c2), cexp, nat0)))
  eqeq12d(cfv(c0, co(c2, cexp, cv(hs0))), co(cfv(c0, c2), cexp, cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, co(c2, cexp, nat0)), co(cfv(c0, c2), cexp, nat0), wceq(cv(hs0), nat0))
  fveq2d(c0, co(c2, cexp, cv(hs0)), co(c2, cexp, nat0), wceq(cv(hs0), nat0))
  oveq2(cv(hs0), nat0, c2, cexp)
  oveq2(cv(hs0), nat0, cfv(c0, c2), cexp)
  imbi2d(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cq)), wceq(cfv(c0, co(c2, cexp, cv(hs0))), co(cfv(c0, c2), cexp, cv(hs0))), wceq(cfv(c0, co(c2, cexp, cv(hs1))), co(cfv(c0, c2), cexp, cv(hs1))))
  eqeq12d(cfv(c0, co(c2, cexp, cv(hs0))), co(cfv(c0, c2), cexp, cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, co(c2, cexp, cv(hs1))), co(cfv(c0, c2), cexp, cv(hs1)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))
  fveq2d(c0, co(c2, cexp, cv(hs0)), co(c2, cexp, cv(hs1)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))
  oveq2(cv(hs0), cv(hs1), c2, cexp)
  oveq2(cv(hs0), cv(hs1), cfv(c0, c2), cexp)
  imbi2d(wceq(cv(hs0), co(cv(hs1), caddc, nat1)), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cq)), wceq(cfv(c0, co(c2, cexp, cv(hs0))), co(cfv(c0, c2), cexp, cv(hs0))), wceq(cfv(c0, co(c2, cexp, co(cv(hs1), caddc, nat1))), co(cfv(c0, c2), cexp, co(cv(hs1), caddc, nat1))))
  eqeq12d(cfv(c0, co(c2, cexp, cv(hs0))), co(cfv(c0, c2), cexp, cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, co(c2, cexp, co(cv(hs1), caddc, nat1))), co(cfv(c0, c2), cexp, co(cv(hs1), caddc, nat1)), wceq(cv(hs0), co(cv(hs1), caddc, nat1)))
  fveq2d(c0, co(c2, cexp, cv(hs0)), co(c2, cexp, co(cv(hs1), caddc, nat1)), wceq(cv(hs0), co(cv(hs1), caddc, nat1)))

  oveq2(cv(hs0), co(cv(hs1), caddc, nat1), cfv(c0, c2), cexp)

  eqeq12d(cfv(c0, co(c2, cexp, cv(hs0))), co(cfv(c0, c2), cexp, cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, co(c2, cexp, c3)), co(cfv(c0, c2), cexp, c3), wceq(cv(hs0), c3))

blocks.name: ostthlem1
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ ostth . If two absolute values agree on the positive integers greater than one, then they agree for all rational numbers and thus are equal as functions. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Sep-2014.)

blocks.name: ostthlem2
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ ostth . Refine ~ ostthlem1 so that it is sufficient to only show equality on the primes. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Sep-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 20-Jun-2015.)

blocks.name: qabsabv
blocks.content: The regular absolute value function on the rationals is in fact an absolute value under our definition. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Sep-2014.)

blocks.name: padicabv
blocks.content: The p-adic absolute value (with arbitrary base) is an absolute value. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Sep-2014.)

  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
} = {

  eqtrd(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cmpt(s1, cq, cif(nat0, co(co(nat1, cdiv, cv(hs0)), cexp, co(cv(hs0), cpc, cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s1), nat0))), cmpt(s1, cq, cif(nat0, co(cv(hs0), cexp, cneg(co(cv(hs0), cpc, cv(s1)))), wceq(cv(s1), nat0))), wcel(cv(hs0), cprime))

  nnne0d(cv(hs0), wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cprime), wcel(cv(s1), cq)), wn(wceq(cv(s1), nat0))))
  ad2antrr(wcel(cv(hs0), cprime), wcel(cv(s1), cq), wn(wceq(cv(s1), nat0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cn))
  sylan2br(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cprime), wcel(cv(s1), cq)), wn(wceq(cv(s1), nat0)), wcel(co(cv(hs0), cpc, cv(s1)), cz), wne(cv(s1), nat0))

blocks.pretty:
thm padicabvf(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ (c0 : Prime → c1)
  ⊣ c2 =(CCfld[|`s]ℚ)
  ⊣ c1 =(AbsVal ` c2)
  ⊣ c0 =(s0 ∈ Prime ↦(s1 ∈ ℚ ↦ if(s1 = 0, 0,(s0[^]-u((s0[pCnt]s1))))))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
} = {
  a1ii((c0 : Prime → c1), d(s0, c1))
  mpbir2an((c0 : Prime → c1), c0[Fn]Prime, ∀(hs0 ∈ Prime,(c0 ` hs0)∈ c1))
  fnmpti(s0, c0, cprime, (s1 ∈ ℚ ↦ if(s1 = 0, 0,(s0[^]-u((s0[pCnt]s1))))))
  mptex(s1, cq, if(s1 = 0, 0,(s0[^]-u((s0[pCnt]s1)))))
  qex()
  rgen(hs0, cprime, (c0 ` hs0)∈ c1)

blocks.content: All positive powers of the p-adic absolute value are absolute values. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Sep-2014.)

  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ+)→(s0 ∈ ℚ ↦(((c2 ` c0)` s0)[^c]c1))∈ c3)
  ⊣ c4 =(CCfld[|`s]ℚ)

blocks.name: ostth1
blocks.content: - Lemma for ~ ostth : trivial case. (Not that the proof is trivial, but that we are proving that the function is trivial.) If ` F ` is equal to ` 1 ` on the primes, then by complete induction and the multiplicative property ~ abvmul of the absolute value, ` F ` is equal to ` 1 ` on all the integers, and ~ ostthlem1 extends this to the other rational numbers. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Sep-2014.)

  -| wceq(c1, cmpt(s1, cq, cif(nat0, nat1, wceq(cv(s1), nat0))))

thm ostth1(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → c0 = c1)
  ⊣ c2 =(CCfld[|`s]ℚ)
  ⊣ c3 =(AbsVal ` c2)
  ⊣ c4 =(s0 ∈ Prime ↦(s1 ∈ ℚ ↦ if(s1 = 0, 0,(s0[^]-u((s0[pCnt]s1))))))
  ⊣ c1 =(s1 ∈ ℚ ↦ if(s1 = 0, 0, 1))
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ c3)
  ⊣ (w0 → ∀(s2 ∈ ℕ, ¬ 1[<](c0 ` s2)))
  ⊣ (w0 → ∀(s2 ∈ Prime, ¬(c0 ` s2)[<]1))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c3)
  ⊣ d(s2, c0)
  ⊣ d(s2, c1)
  ⊣ d(s2, c2)
  ⊣ d(s2, c3)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
  ⊣ d(s1, w0)
  ⊣ d(s2, w0)
} = {
  a1ii((w0 → c0 = c1), c4 =(s0 ∈ Prime ↦(s1 ∈ ℚ ↦ if(s1 = 0, 0,(s0[^]-u((s0[pCnt]s1)))))))
  a1ii((w0 → c0 = c1), d(s0, s1))
  a1ii((w0 → c0 = c1), d(s0, s2))
  a1ii((w0 → c0 = c1), d(s0, c0))
  a1ii((w0 → c0 = c1), d(s0, c3))

  a1ii((w0 → c0 = c1), d(s1, c3))
  a1ii((w0 → c0 = c1), d(s2, c2))
  a1ii((w0 → c0 = c1), d(s0, w0))
  a1ii((w0 → c0 = c1), d(s1, w0))
  ostthlem2(s2, c0, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  mp1i(w0, c1 ∈ c3, c2 ∈ DivRing)
  qdrng(c2)
  abvtriv(s1, c2, c1, c3, cq, nat0)

  r19.21bi(s2, cprime, w0, ¬(c0 ` s2)[<]1)

thm ostth2(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → ∃(s0 ∈(0[(,]]1), c0 =(s1 ∈ ℚ ↦((abs ` s1)[^c]s0))))
  ⊣ c1 =(CCfld[|`s]ℚ)
  ⊣ c2 =(AbsVal ` c1)
  ⊣ c3 =(s2 ∈ Prime ↦(s3 ∈ ℚ ↦ if(s3 = 0, 0,(s2[^]-u((s2[pCnt]s3))))))
  ⊣ c4 =(s3 ∈ ℚ ↦ if(s3 = 0, 0, 1))
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ c2)
  ⊣ (w0 → c5 ∈(ℤ≥ ` 2))
  ⊣ (w0 → 1[<](c0 ` c5))
  ⊣ c6 =((log `(c0 ` c5))[÷](log ` c5))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, s3)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)

blocks.name: ostth
blocks.content: Ostrowski's theorem, which classifies all absolute values on ` QQ ` . Any such absolute value must either be the trivial absolute value ` K ` , a constant exponent ` 0 < a <_ 1 ` times the regular absolute value, or a positive exponent times the p-adic absolute value. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Sep-2014.)
